alert.note: Alert for Breathitt; Clay; Leslie; Owsley; Perry (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 23 at 7:55PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Kentucky, including the following counties, Breathitt, Clay, Leslie, Owsley and Perry. * WHEN...Until 1100 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 755 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hazard, Hyden, Buckhorn, Dryhill, Kaliopi, Toulouse, Confluence, Mosley Bend, Thousandsticks, Shoal, Buckhorn Lake S.P., Wooton, Krypton, Wendover, Hosea, Avawam, Gays Creek, Sizerock, Saul and Chavies. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
